title: ISic001192. I.Sicily inscription 001192
body:
1οἱ ἀλειφόμε[νοι]
2Ἀγάθαρχον
3Ἡρακλείου

1ΟΙΑΛΕΙΦΟΜΕ[...]
2ΑΓΑΘΑΡΧΟΝ
3ΗΡΑΚΛΕΙΟΥ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text according to Kaibel in IG ;
  • 2: Gualtherus: ΑΝΑΟΑΡΧΟΝ. Bartholini: ΑΝΑΣΙΑΡΧΟΝ. Wilamowitz: Ἀνά[ξ]αρχον.

English translation

Matthew Hewitt

The annointed (honour) Agatharchos, son of Herakleios.

commentary

The stone was seen by Gualtherus, but (contra Fuduli 2017: 176, who seems to misread Salinas' report in NSA 1880, pp. 191-195, referring a description of IG XIV.370 to this text), was no longer discoverable when Salinas visited in 1880.

bibliography

  • 14.0369 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • Gualtherus 1624 [1625] no.316 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001931
  • Castelli 1769 cl.6 no.2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002084
  • 3.5609 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001252
  • Cordiano 1997 45 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002064
  • Fuduli 2017 174 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002811
